about.title: About Us
about.aboutTitle: Hipper Machines – Where Tradition Meets Precision
about.aboutText1: Hipper Machines was founded by Christoph Hipper, an experienced bassoonist and machine builder based in Rohrdorf, Germany, near Salzburg.
about.aboutText2: With decades of experience in professional reed making, Christoph Hipper has developed machines that combine the highest precision with practical handling. Each machine is the result of intensive development work and direct feedback from professional musicians worldwide.
about.aboutText3: In our workshop in Rohrdorf, all machines are handcrafted. Quality and precision always come first.
about.philosophyText1: We believe in combining traditional craftsmanship with cutting-edge milling technology. Our unique tip-profiling machines and gouging machines enable musicians to produce many high-quality reeds in a short time – without the usually lengthy break-in period.
about.philosophyText2: All machines are delivered with carbide-tipped cutters that stay sharp for many, many reeds. Another advantage: The cane doesn't have to be soaked – our machines work with dry cane.
about.specializationText: Our machines are specially developed for bassoon, contrabassoon, oboe, cor anglais, and Viennese oboe. They can be adapted for any other double reed instrument.

duplikator.intro: For oboe, bassoon, contrabassoon. Can be adapted for any other double reed instrument.
duplikator.uniqueFeature: This unique tip-profiling machine can copy from a model as well as directly from a reed.
duplikator.functionsTitle: This unique tip-profiling machine has 3 functions:
duplikator.function1: It can be used as a tip-profiling machine by copying from a template onto the reed blank. The entire surface of the reed is machined by a fine special ball-end cutter running at 20,000 rpm, producing an almost polished finish.
duplikator.function2: With this special cutter, you can also directly copy a reed, i.e., copy from reed to reed. For this, the included tongue is mounted with a template on the tongue carrier. A counterweight ensures that the tracing ball doesn't travel over the reed with too much pressure.
duplikator.function3: It is also possible to copy from a reed onto a pre-milled brass template, thus creating a new, custom template for use with the tip-profiling machine.
duplikator.benefits: Working with the optimized standard model results in instantly playable reeds – no more tedious break-in time necessary! If the reed has a few days or more after tip-profiling to adjust to the new thickness ratios, you will have saved at least a week of scraping and playing-in time when you begin to break in these reeds! A beneficial side effect is that you can very quickly assess how good the cane is and how good the quality of the finished reed will be. With this template, it is possible to produce many good reeds in a short time.
duplikator.cutterInfo: The special cutter is good for many, many reeds and is available at a very reasonable price. This specialized cutter, set on a high-speed spindle, produces a very fine finish.

gougingMachine.intro: For oboe, cor anglais, Viennese oboe, bassoon.
gougingMachine.description: Unrivalled gouging machine for gouging cane.
gougingMachine.features: Cane can be gouged either straight or with a center dip. The center dip guarantees better results, especially with softer cane.
gougingMachine.dryMilling: The cane doesn't have to be soaked – the machine works with dry cane.
gougingMachine.cutter: The cutter is carbide tipped, it stays sharp for many, many reeds!

profilingMachine.description: New design enables profiling in one run, i.e. the cane doesn't have to be turned and can be machined continuously.
profilingMachine.dryMilling: The cane doesn't have to be soaked. The profiling machine mills dry cane.
profilingMachine.cutter: The cutter is carbide tipped, it stays sharp for many, many reeds!

ausreiber.intro: Hand tool for bassoon reed making.
ausreiber.description: The reamer with adjustable stop allows precise and reproducible reaming of the cane. The depth stop guarantees consistent results with every reed.
ausreiber.features: High-quality spiral drill bit made of hardened steel. The stop is infinitely adjustable for individual settings.

aufbindedorn.intro: Classic tool for bassoon reed making.
aufbindedorn.description: The conical brass mandrel is used for binding the reeds. The precisely crafted shape ensures optimal fit and facilitates even winding.
aufbindedorn.features: Made from solid brass with an ergonomic wooden handle for comfortable working.

schabedorn.description: The scraping mandrel provides the perfect support for fine scraping. The optimal contour supports even wall thicknesses.
schabedorn.features: Precision-turned brass tip with ergonomic beechwood handle.

aufdrueckdorn.description: The pressing mandrel can be used to reshape older reeds. Ideal for reforming and correcting the opening.
aufdrueckdorn.features: Conical brass tip with fine surface for gentle pressing.
